info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 23 at 9:27PM EDT until March 23 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR TRANSYLVANIA COUNTY... At 927 PM EDT, Lingering heavy showers will continue to aggravate saturated soil conditions countywide through late evening, and also maintain high water conditions and elevated stream, creek and river levels. Flooding of low-lying areas is likely to remain as well. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brevard, Rosman, Looking Glass, Lake Toxaway, Gorges State Park, Dupont State Forest, Connestee, Balsam Grove, Penrose, Cedar Mountain, and Sapphire. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Heavy rain is increasing the risk of landslides, especially in areas where slides have occurred in the past. Be especially alert if you are near a stream, especially at the base of a mountain or in a cove. Watch for loose-moving soil and rocks or a sudden increase in streamflow. Leave the area quickly if this is observed. When driving along roads where the terrain is steep or rocky, watch and listen for falling rocks, mud, trees and other debris. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
